subject: Re: [junit] Is this an acceptable style?
msgSnippet: Jonathan Oddy wrote:  ... use. I think that the fact that you extracted a smaller interface from A for B to use implies that that smaller interface
messageBody:
Jonathan Oddy wrote:

<snip />

> But now my question, I've extracted this interface but where should I put
> it?
>
> I seem to have a couple of options: firstly as an interface in its own
> little Java file, and secondly as a nested interface within class B. I was
> wondering what other people did in this (I assume) reasonably common
> scenario? I am currently coming down on the side of the second option,
> primarily because the interface is specific to B and currently I do not see
> any future in it being a standalone interface. Also whilst nested within B
> it provides a better (more accurate?) level of documentation/intent of its
use.

I think that the fact that you extracted a smaller interface from A for
B to use implies that that smaller interface means something. You just
haven't figured out what it means, yet. If you could get concrete about
it, we could help you name it appropriately.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
